Description: Body sherd with handle root of Chian black-figured Animal pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of lotus flower in added white outline and added red centre above two pairs of narrow white bands; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of dolphin (only tail missing) to left; blob rosettes as filling ornament; below two lines; below, in handle zone, part of double saw-edged metope pattern and group of vertical strokes above two brown bands on cul.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 331, no. 1597, pl. 204)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 83, no. 42, pl. V)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1300) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
